content: Coast to Coast got really boring after Art left. They rarely talk about ghosts, satanic posession, or aliens anymore. I do remember "Y2K" being a gigantic topic back then, dozens of "experts" were lining up to talk about how the world was about to end. If history has proven one thing, it's that the "end is near" types are ALWAYS wrong.

They rarely talk about ghosts, satanic posession, or aliens anymore. I do remember "Y2K" being a gigantic topic back then, dozens of "experts" were lining up to talk about how the world was about to end. If history has proven one thing, it's that the "end is near" types are ALWAYS wrong. I remember a Mad magazine cartoon from when I was a kid, showed this bearded guy wearing a sandwich board that said, "THE END IS NEAR", so he rounds a turn and steps off the curb and gets nailed by a bus, yup, for him, the "END WAS NEAR"... LOL Respectfully, SUNLINER81 But I don't see this mentioned in my beloved copy of Nostradamus? How can it be true? Dave It is the date that the Mayan calader ends. There is nothing suggesting that everything ends or that there is some catastrophy, it is just the last date on that calendar. Who knows if it would have been updated if they hadn't been wiped out centuries ago.
